topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Install the Service Installer

section.p: The installation procedure has changed significantly since the last release. The HDP Installer 2.0, also known as HDPI, is a plugin for the the python-openstackclient (OSC). It is able to leverage the authentication, configuration and command line option parsing that is already part of OSC to greatly simplify the installation process.
section.title: Download the Latest Version of the HPE Helion Development Platform Installation Client
section.p: The installation is provided as a small compressed tar file.

ol.li: Navigate to the HPE Helion Download Network (HDN) and log in. If necessary, create an account first.
Download the latest Development Platform Installer package.

section.title: Install the HPE Helion Development Platform Installation Client
section.note: You must have satisfied all prerequisites before beginning installation.
Do not source service.osrc, keystone.osrc, or any other *rc file before you begin.

ol.li: SSH to the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer.

Create and source the Virtual Environment. In this example, <dpi-venv>.tgz is the name of the installer. This process creates a directory under /opt which is owned by root. This requires sudo to create, so the owner of that folder needs to be changed to whatever the user will log in as; in this example, the value is stack.sudo mkdir -p /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv> sudo tar -C /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv> -xzf <dpi-venv>.tgz sudo chown stack.stack /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv> source /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv>/bin/activate
Test the installation by retrieving a list of installable files. The --debug option will return information vital for troubleshooting, if necessary.openstack hdpi --os-cloud mycloud list --debug
